channel.title: jimgrisham tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from jimgrisham.

item.description: @LaurenKGurley @jmkorhonen Amazon pays for fuel and ‚Äú10¬¢ per delivery‚Äù!?! Did I mis-read that?

Very interesting thread‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs worth reading from the top: https://t.co/qJAJfTUCgi
@YellowAfterlife @krisnova Just government websites (ostensibly to prevent DDOS and defacement attacks) or commercial / private ones as well?

@MSzafranski413 @DanLamothe Keep in mind someone saying they ‚Äúcannot corroborate‚Äù something doesn‚Äôt mean they can‚Äôt have detailed confirmed intelligence on a topic. Not having permission to corroborate something can also result in that response, and the IC will ultimately share only what it wants to share.
@iyad_elbaghdadi There‚Äôs also a Youtube link in the replies: https://t.co/z3degSam5n
@PetrolePassion @UAWeapons ATC showed at least one large Spanish military cargo plane arriving within the past 8 hours‚Ä¶ and based on recent angry talk from the Kremlin‚Ä¶ yes.

@cormacleane @mairtinofaolain @evangershkovich Unverified: V - Marines Z - Eastern Military District Z in a square - Southern Military District (Crimea) O - units from Belarus X - forces of Ramzan Kadyrov, Putin installed warlord of Chechnya A - Russian Special Forces(SSO) (e.g. Spetznaz)

@Burn_the_fleet @Zingarella9 @BarakRavid Oh, of course. üòâ It also seems that maintaining a low altitude could be quite useful when tracking / discriminating high-altitude objects. They seemed to be interested in keeping their port side towards the other flight as much as possible, and now #RTB. Coincidence; my bad. https://t.co/lsklbw8SL2

Letting Russia get away with this sort of thing only strengthens the logical/strategic case for nations like Iran to continue to rapidly develop new weapons and for the DPRK, India, France, Pakistan, Israel, etc. to maintain their current inventories.
